abstracts.cdata!:
The main thrust of this report is to
            define and weigh both negative impacts and positive benefits
            of the Yunnan Environmental Project (YEP) and to identify
            appropriate measures to mitigate adverse impacts in the
            project cities.  The objectives of this report are: 1) to
            summarize the results of the environmental impact
            assessments for each of the YEP World Bank funded
            sub-projects; 2) to identify both the critical environmental
            problems to be addressed, and those produced by project
            implementation; 3) to assess the merits of alternative
            solutions to these problems in environmental, social and
            economic terms; and 4) to evaluate and recommend
            interventions for mitigation of problems.  Chapter 2 of the
            report discusses the institutional environment that governs
            the environment in Yunnan Province.  Chapter 3 describes the
            components of the YEP.  Chapter 4 describes the baseline
            conditions in the project area.  Chapter 5 assesses the
            impacts and mitigation measures required for the various
            proposed components and summarizes the cost and benefits for
            each component.  Chapter 6 is devoted to discussions on the
            alternatives based on the environmental and economic
            assessments.  Chapter 7 describes the public consultation
            and participation process together with the results of the
            surveys carried out.  Chapter 8 gives a brief summary of the
            resettlement proposals.  Finally, chapter 9 describes the
            procedures required to monitor the performance of the
            proposed components to assess their effect on improvements
            of the environment of Lake Dianchi.
